name: Corporaci√≥n Andina de Fomento
goal: CAF is a development bank created in 1970, owned by 19 countries - 17 of Latin America and the Caribbean, Spain and Portugal- as well as 14 private banks in the region. It promotes a sustainable development model through credit operations, non-reimbursable resources, and support in the technical and financial structuring of projects in the public and private sectors of Latin America. With headquarters in Caracas, Venezuela , CAF has offices in Buenos Aires, La Paz, Brasilia, Bogota, Quito, Madrid, Mexico D.F, Panama City, Asuncion, Lima, Montevideo and Port of Spain.
interests: External Relations, International co-operation and development
euInitiatives:
CAF wishes to foster relations between the EU and Latin America and the Caribbean in order to promote the sustainable development and regional integration of our shareholder countries. In this regard, we have signed MoUs with the European Commission and the EU-LAC Foundation.
CAF has co-financed several development projects in Latin America together with the European Investment Bank (eg. Panama Canal expansion).
We are partners with the EU for the implementation of the Latin American Investment Facility and are currently looking forward to participate in the Caribbean Investment Facility.
We are mainly interested in EU policies related to development cooperation and external relations, with a focus on Latin America.
